39029111.review:
I guess I shouldn't complain about a free game, but there isn't anything to it.  It is exactly as described and it delivers exactly what it says, but I lost interest quickly.  I would like it more with an 'undo' and some sort of measurement of gallery visitor reactions (like a tally of how many people visited and percentage or count of their reactions to various paintings -- and maybe a way to mark a painting 'ready' so visitors aren't critiquing blank canvases). 

Pros: 
nice music
nice reactions from gallery visitors
nice stencils, though limited 
relaxing

Cons: 
no undo 
no mirroring effect
limited rotation options
the extra stencils you can buy are more numerous, but a stencil is a stencil.
gallery visitors don't count for anything, so there's no point trying to please some majority (which, to be fair, isn't that different from the actual art world)

Overall, the controls are too limited to let you do any meaningful 'art' so to make something nice, you are better off editing elsewhere and manually adding to your gallery -- but then why are you bothering to add anything to gallery rather than posting it to your favorite website?

35877361.review:
Not the most detailed or intense game, but perfect for when you just want something simple and relaxing.

In this game, you decorate canvases in an art gallery using spray paint. That's it. It's a simple concept, but the fact that there's so much you can do with it makes this a very fun game that you could potentially spend hours on.

The controls are simple and easy to figure out, meaning you can dive right in and start painting. The game gives you a choice between many different shapes for painting, and instead of choosing from pre-selected colors, you get a slider so you can choose any color you want (a feature which I am [i]very[/i] happy about).

There's also some classy-sounding piano music, some funny-looking people who occasionally pop in to see your work, and a nice city scape outside to provide atmosphere.

There's not much else I can say. This is a simple game about spray painting that makes spray painting fun!

31745977.review:
갤러리 제작 게임.

플레이어는 새하얀 갤러리의 주인입니다.
주변을 둘러보면 보이는 것은 하얀 벽과 하얀 캔버스!!
천장에는 구멍이 뚫려 하늘이 보이고 닫혀있는 문 너머로는 도로와 차들이 보입니다.

플레이어는 이곳에서 자유롭게 플레이하면 됩니다.
아무런 주제로 아무런 제제도 아무런 방해도 없는 이곳에서
자신의 상상력을 마음껏 발휘하여 그리고 쓰고 난장판으로!!!

WASD로 이동하고, 마우스 좌클릭으로 그리기, 우클릭은 색 담기, 휠로 크기 조정.
스페이스바로 아트 화면을 오픈하여 색상을 변경하거나
특정 문양 등을 선택하여 사용할 수 있습니다.
DLC를 사면 더 많은 문양을 사용할 수 있다는 점!

그림을 그리다보면 관객들이 나타나 그림을 관찰합니다.
딱히 평가한다거나 그런건 아니지만, 웃는 표정 화난 표정 무표정한 얼굴 등에 움찔하기도 하죠.
오히려 너무 자유로워서 무엇을 해야할지 난감한 기분도 드는 게임.

아쉬운 점
-이동이 살짝 답답함/ 점프 기능이 없으니 어색
-자유로워서 오히려 불편한 기분도?

31467718.review:
Canvas The Gallery ist kein Spiel an sich, sondern ein Programm um Bilder zu erstellen und mit Freunden zu Teilen. Ich pack das mal bei "Lernspielen" ins Archiv. Denn man kann sich auf "spielerische" Weise mit Kunst und Bildgestaltung beschäftigen. Die Möglichkeiten im Programm selbst zur Erstellung von Bilder ist recht begrenzt. Interessant ist aber die Möglichkeit sehr einfach Bilder auf dem Computer auf diese Weise mit Freunden zu teilen die sich die Bilder in einer virtuellen Galerie betrachten können. 
Interessante Idee, allerdings sollte das Importieren der Bilder noch etwas vereinfacht werden und die eigenen Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten sowohl für das Erstellen von Bilder wie auch der Galerie selbst noch erweitert werden.

30971303.review:
Really neat free tool. I exchanged photos with friends and it was really fun making a game out of it. Out of all, I totally reccomend you play, but if you want to know more, read below.


Canvas The Gallery is an artistic game to "Express Yourself".  Albeit that could totally be what it's used for, I just fucked around in it, spraypainted the walls and pissed off my visitors. The game is amazing, although it does deserve more mechanics, maybe this game could be turned into the classic Artist sim, where you create your art and then sell it to unsuspecting customers who think it looks like total shit and tip you 4 dollars, because they're dissapointed but still feel bad. All jokes aside, the game needs a bit more polish but I think it really just needs better models, textures, sounds and a new UI. The plain, basic UI of this game is boring and bland compared to the game and its' creativity. I reccomend a UI creator for the community, possibly a workshop for it because like I mentioned before, it looks bad. Really bad. The spray paint animations need a bit of redoing, especially when switching to a new color because a mist of the color you chose goes everywhere and just doesn't make much sense. The model doesn't look the best, but it's not that important. I do feel that there needs to be a day-night cycle in the game just because, it'd be nice to see the paintings in different, more ambient lighting. Possibly a new place to paint or a different section with different sized canvases.

Overall, this game is great and is definetely deserving of a go, being free and all. And I totally think you should buy the DLC, it may not be much and you may not use it every day, but the devs need the money so that they can update this game and possibly make it into much more than it already is. I love this game.


Tl;Dr: Get the game, and get the DLC if you can afford it. The game needs a bit of polish but is great. I reccomend.

29997769.review:
This is a pretty neat game to just screw around with for free, but if I were to improve it in anyway, I would:
[list]
 [*] Make it so you could be able to crouch & use a ladder or something.
 [*] Multiplayer of some sort, to make it possible for you and your friends to draw dicks, [i]together[/i].
 [*] Maybe a means of putting a little cassete player in your hands or something. That you can use to swap to either, play your own music, that you could somehow import into the game. Or maybe some original works. While you paint.
 [*] Mac & Linux support. (I dont know much about Unity but I imagine it wouldnt be too hard to do)
 [*] & Generally more tools to change how the brush works. (hardeness, shape, ink pen, etc)
[/list]
But for now, I've spent maybe 45 minutes playing this game, making only a few paintings. Though I intend to spend many more on it. There is something kinda fun to just kicking back, playing some music, and painting as many dicks as you damn well please.

29967696.review:
+ Allows for plenty of creativity
+ Takes place in an attractive art gallery
+ Excellent choice of stencils
+ Easy to select the right color
+ Can share the art with other people
+/- Hard to get your positioning right, but perhaps that becomes easier with practice

Make up your own mind with this gameplay: [url]https://youtu.be/5OyXIRmbWFM[/url]

29967224.review:
Fun game, once i figured out how to change the brush size and colour (instructions somewhere would have bee nice).
I noticed some minor problems. In window mode the window changes it's size back to near fullscreen size as soon as I enter or leave a gallery. Also rotating the objects is frustrating at times since they don't turn around so easily and then they turn too much. After a little patching I believe this game will very enjoyable.
